territorial_changes.description: Russian annexation of Crimea and parts of four southeast Ukrainian oblasts in 2014 and 2022, respectively
territorial_changes.current_occupation: Russian occupation of about 18% of Ukrainian territory as of November 2022

Ukraine.support: Various countries providing aid since 2022 (see military aid to Ukraine)

casualties_and_losses.reports: Tens of thousands at a minimum
casualties_and_losses.details: See Casualties of the Russo-Ukrainian War for detailed information

overview.description: The Russo-Ukrainian War is an ongoing international conflict between Russia and Ukraine, which began in February 2014 following Ukraine's Revolution of Dignity. The conflict includes the annexation of Crimea, the Donbas war, and a full-scale invasion in 2022.

developments.events: Annexation of Crimea, Donbas war begins.
Full-scale invasion of Ukraine by Russia.

recent_developments.2023: Russia digs into positions ahead of another Ukrainian counteroffensive.
recent_developments.refugee_crisis: The war has resulted in a refugee crisis.

summary: The Russo-Ukrainian War is a significant and ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine, marked by territorial annexations, political tensions, and significant military
